Gioco pieno di Cheater che hanno vita facile all'interno del gioco, in quanto NON vengono bannati nonostante le prove e le segnalazioni, però bannano a caso i giocatori che pubblicizzano il loro gioco senza accertarsi se il nickname corrisponde effettivamente alla persona. 

Gioco pieno di Bug che puntualmente non fixano nonostante loro dicano di sì, colpi Wi-fi da parte dei killer e hit scandalose, Dead hard/morto stecchito che parte 1 volta su 20, server che pingano mostruosamente e spesso capitano dei bug dove non si viene ricompensati dei propri blood points dopo una partita o dopo il compimento di una missione.

Carino solo se si vuole fare una partita come "kill your friends" in Premade da 5 (contando il killer) senza prenderlo seriamente, per il resto meglio starne alla larga ANCHE per la tossicità dei giocatori che augurano le peggio cose nella chat endgame (chat inutile, tra l'altro), se volete buttarvi sui multiplayer online cercate qualcos'altro di gestito meglio sia a livello di programmazione, che di cheating e fandom.

Dead by Daylight is a truly unique game, a pioneer in the field.  But I can't in good conscience recommend a game in as poorly maintained a state as this one is.  

Both before and after the recently introduced MMR system, upon reaching rank 8 as killer, you WILL be matched with exclusively ranks 1-3 survivors with at the very least 1000 hours in the game (usually more, even double or triple that).  I have never seen a purple rank survivor at killer rank 8 or higher in my life.  

I've gone at least 30 games in a row, alternating between getting four kills with ease at rank 9, ranking up, getting 0 kills at rank 8 and having every generator completed in ~5 minutes, then ranking back down to rank 9.  

The final straw was going against a full rank 1 SWF party (still at killer rank 8, mind you).  After completing that match, I collected myself and decided upon the following:  I would play one more match, and if the same thing happened, I was done.  After all the good and bad times this game had given me, I would finally uninstall.

I queue up, and load, and load... and load.  And load some more.  

10 minutes pass and I'm hit with an error message and am disconnected, unable to reconnect.  The servers are down.

BHVR is a cruel mistress, for she'll always promise you a solution and dangle it right in front of your face, only to reveal it changes absolutely nothing.  Don't simp for Mathieu Cote.  Don't suffer like I did.  Just walk away.

EDIT:  Came back after matchmaking was "fixed".  It's even worse now, happens from Rank 12 instead of Rank 8.  Absolute clown devs.

After your first few hours the game isn't scary with the exception of the occasional jump scare when someone sneaks up on you. 
Chases get the blood flowing, very exciting feeling. Haven't got that feeling playing any games in the past.
 
The devs do a good job at keeping updates and hot fixes flowing. Very active in the community and constantly keeping things balanced.

The community is only as toxic as you make it. If you start throwing a fit about something you are liable to be trolled to no end, but if you are a good sport you will be met with the same behavior.

If you are easily frustrated this game may not be for you. Very steep learning curve but also tons of players happy to help you overcome it.

Don't buy if you are doing it for killer, latest updates have made killer nearly unplayable.  Survivors have every way including game programming to make sure they don't get hooked.  I get things need balance but the one thing that is a big deal for killer that has not changed is gen rush speeds, with everything else it's just no fun casual killer fun.  All you will find are meta perk T bagging groups of survivors with group communication most times.  I want my time back....


RE DLC was supposed to be an awesome fun time....yeah now Capcom should charge BHVR 3 times for this garbage.  Still game breaking bugs, matchmaking is in the tanks now, I like killer over solo survivor.  Biggest problem is the HUGE wait for a game to either get a toxic SWF or high ranked 4k hours in survivor.  Did I mention the map i paid for is still not able to be used... oh but it was working fine in the PTB....wtf BHVR get your other hand out of your pants and WORK.

After some time after my last review my current disappointment in DBD is VERY HIGH as a killer main that is, with this next patch and boon totems it is VERY obvious BHVR  care only for the survivor stream crews.  I've tried to come back only to find killer way behind and getting screwed out of hits with auto aim or infinite chance survivor builds now a days, give it time soon survivors will wonder why there is such a long que time....lol

It is just so bad right now for solo and more to for killer, don't buy this game if you think you can pull off killer

Ótimo jogo para chegar do trabalho, pensando em colocar pessoas no gancho e vê-las correndo gritando.

Nos ranks mais baixos a comunidade é extremamente tóxica, principalmente pelo lado dos sobreviventes, no rank alto não presenciei toxicidade.

Ambientação, trilha sonora, referências excelentes para quem ama horror.

Adorei o jogo, to jogando o tempo todo pois achei muito divertido. É ótimo para jogar com amigos. Senti bastante tensão jogando enquanto o monstro vinha atrás de mim, e isso enriquece o game. Recomendo bastante, o jogo não é pesado e roda em qualquer PC mediano, o meu esta rodando no ultra mesmo meu PC não sendo tão novo mas é ótimo pra jogar.

One of the worst games i have ever played. Extremely unbalanced no matter which side you choose to play, you will always go against someone toxic af. you will either get killers who sit there and focus you down and sit there and make sure you die and overall make it unfun, or you will get survivors who bully you all game and teabag at the exit gates or spam click flashlights. The game is so tilting that im sure if you asked anyone who has played over 100-200 hours they will say they've rage deleted the game at least once.the player base is extremely toxic and the devs are blind to the imperfections of the game and instead of fixing the bugs they have, they add more content that also brings bugs which make the game literally unpayable. This game could be so much better and has so much potential but it fails at so many aspects. And don't even get me started on the hit validation...

Overall 10/10 would recommend

Very fun, but not very casual friendly. You'll need to put plenty of hours into the game to truly understand how to survive and/or kill the survivors. Once you do, the game becomes very enjoyable. Especially for die-hard fans of the horror genre. This is the only game, as when this review is being written, to which you can become the iconic Freddy Krueger from "The NIghtmare on Elm Street" franchise, or maybe even Michael Myers from the "Halloween" franchise, while you chase around Nancy and Steve from "Stranger Things" while they work along with Bill from the "Left 4 Dead" series and Detective Tapp from "Saw". This game, considering where it started and what it has become, is (in my opinion) a must buy but be warned of the skill gap. The game will not be easy to start and it's truly difficult to master, but that's why it is so fun. This game, to put it simply, is endless fun.

This game is amazing. I mean, I have experienced a lot of bugs, but i guess that if I've been playing it for more than a year, and I'm still enjoying it, I should definietly post a positive review. The community is extremally toxic in most cases, but you can still find nice people. There's a ton of well written lore, but most people seem to not care about it. I think this game deserves an 8/10 and will be my favourite game for a long time. Keep up the good work Behaviour, and stay motivated!

This is honestly a great game in my opinion. To put it simply, the gameplay is fun, the game never gets repetitive, and there's loads of customizations and DLCs to fit your theme and play style. Its more than just a horror game, it's a game of tactics, action, and competition. It can even be played casually, if that's your style. This is a game with no niche, a game that, no matter who you are or how you play, will always be enjoyable.
very dun game and its very addicting to play

Final edit: They removed the garbage matchmaking system they implemented last week. Buy the game it's lots of fun if you're willing to learn.

Edit: Changing my review to yes because after playing for another 8ish hours matchmaking has improved some. Expect to still get absolutely smashed as a new player until you lose enough games for it to place you correctly. Some matches still are pretty mismatched as well.

I cannot in good faith recommend this game right now with the new matchmaking update. It's an incredibly fun game with a steep learning curve but with the new matchmaking system the game is putting really high ranked players with thousands of hours against new players and it is an awful experience.

Dead by Daylight is a fun game to play with your friends, its mechanics allow for an actually interesting and fun experience.

Despite that, I do have an issue with the DLC Killers, they are ridiculously unbalanced, allowing just about anyone, even brand new players to the game such as myself, for the killers it makes the game so easy it stops being fun, and for the survivors it makes it unfair to go up against.

Such as the nurse & spirit, their abilities make the game virtually unplayable, in the end the game is fun, but if you use the DLC Killers your cock is incredibly small.
